question.body: The density of touch receptors varies in different regions/locations of the body. Which location would you predict has the most densely concentrated touch receptors?

response.feedback: Incorrect. While it is sensitive, much of the sensitivity comes from the hair root plexus detecting movement of hair and not direct touch receptors.
Incorrect. This area has more widely distributed touch receptors but is more sensitive to pain than the correct choice.
Correct. These areas have the densest concentration of touch receptors, being very sensitive.
Incorrect. These areas have more widely distributed touch receptors.
Incorrect. While more sensitive than some of the other choices, it is not the most sensitive choice, especially with the extra stratum lucidum layer of thick skin.
